title: Ticket #3801: Negotiator excepts sending match_info with CCB enabled
description:
Configure a personal condor with 200 static slots, and ccb with 
STARTD.CCB_ADDRESS = $(COLLECTOR_HOST)
STARTD.PRIVATE_NETWORK_NAME = cs.wisc.edu

submit a cluster of 200 long running sleep jobs, and eventually the negotiator aborts with 

07/23/13 16:42:47 matchmakingAlgorithm: limit 187.000000 used 0.000000 pieLeft 187.000000
07/23/13 16:42:47 Start of sorting MatchList (len=187)
07/23/13 16:42:47 Finished sorting MatchList
07/23/13 16:42:47       Connecting to startd slot47@chevre.cs.wisc.edu at <128.105.14.141:44882?CCBID=128.105.14.141:4210#2694&PrivNet=cs.wisc.edu>
07/23/13 16:42:47       Sending PERMISSION, claim id, startdAd to schedd
07/23/13 16:42:47       Matched 114.50 gthain@chevre.cs.wisc.edu <128.105.14.141:35038> preempting none <128.105.14.141:44882?CCBID=128.105.14.141:4210#2694&PrivNet=cs.wisc.edu> slot47@chevre.cs.wisc.edu
07/23/13 16:42:47       Notifying the accountant
07/23/13 16:42:47       Successfully matched with slot47@chevre.cs.wisc.edu
07/23/13 16:42:47 ERROR "Selector::add_fd(): fd -1 outside valid range 0-1023" at line 196 in file /scratch/gthain/CONDOR_SRC/src/condor_utils/selector.cpp
remarks:
2013-Jul-23 16:56:06 by danb:
The problematic code comes from [35432] in DaemonCore::ServiceCommandSock(): 
        else if( ((*sockTable)[i].iosock) &&
                 (i != initial_command_sock) &&
                 ((*sockTable)[i].waiting_for_data) &&
                 ((*sockTable)[i].is_connect_pending == false)) {
            selector.add_fd( (*sockTable)[i].iosock->get_file_desc(), Selector::IO_READ );
        }

This code does not reproduce the logic in DaemonCore::Driver() when adding sockets to the selector. In this specific case, it does not check for is_reverse_connect_pending. There appear to be other inconsistencies.

2013-Jul-24 17:06:17 by gthain:
Presumably, setting

SERVICE_COMMAND_SOCKET_MAX_SOCKET_INDEX to -2 should also work around the problem.

2013-Jul-25 10:11:01 by tstclair:
How old is this?

2013-Jul-25 10:37:18 by gthain:
The bug came into 7.9.6 from #3535

2013-Jul-26 11:09:09 by gthain:
CODE REVIEW This looks good. Can we also put a comment in DaemonCore::Driver that if code changes in the main loop there, that ServiceCommandSocket might also need to be changed?

2013-Aug-06 15:06:22 by danb:
I added a comment in the code.

2013-Aug-14 12:43:27 by danb:
I just discovered that the schedd is also affected by this bug. "But the schedd doesn't call ServiceCommandSocket()!," you say. To my surprise, this is not true. DaemonCore itself calls ServiceCommandSocket() in HungChildTimeout(): 

    // now we give the child one last chance to save itself.  we do this by
    // servicing any waiting commands, since there could be a child_alive
    // command sitting there in our receive buffer.  the reason we do this
    // is to handle the case where both the child _and_ the parent have been
    // hung for a period of time (e.g. perhaps the log files are on a hard
    // mounted NFS volume, and everyone was blocked until the NFS server
    // returned).  in this situation we should try to avoid killing the child.
    // so service the buffered commands and check if the was_not_responding
    // flag flips back to false.
    ServiceCommandSocket();

I actually observed an 8.0.1 schedd die because of this.
